Question: Bug casting String, Integer, Double using HashMap: :I have some strange bug on Android 2.3 and lower.I have following code:HashMap<Somekey, Object> data = new HashMap<Somekey, Object>();data.put(somekey, "asdfdsafdsf");String value = (String) data.get(somekey);on the last line I have ClassCastException: get(somekey) returns Boolean value instead of String. This error appears not only with String type, with Integer and Double too.I don't understand why, because this code correctly works on android 4.0.3 and higher.
Please using this api: Map.get.
Answer:

Question: Bug casting String, Integer, Double using HashMap: :I have some strange bug on Android 2.3 and lower.I have following code:HashMap<Somekey, Object> data = new HashMap<Somekey, Object>();data.put(somekey, "asdfdsafdsf");String value = (String) data.get(somekey);on the last line I have ClassCastException: get(somekey) returns Boolean value instead of String. This error appears not only with String type, with Integer and Double too.I don't understand why, because this code correctly works on android 4.0.3 and higher.
Please using this api: Map.get.
Answer: <<<api>>>: Map.get
<<<code>>>: data.get(somekey)
<<<explanation>>>: The Map.get method returns an Object, so you need to cast it to the appropriate type. In this case, you need to cast it to String.

Question: How to prevent ClassCastException in HashMap: :I have a HashMap with key and value as String. I want to prevent ClassCastException. What is the best way to do this?
Answer: <<<api>>>: Map.get
<<<code>>>: data.get(somekey)
<<<explanation>>>: The Map.get method returns an Object, so you need to cast it to the appropriate type. In this case, you need to cast it to String. If the key does not exist in the map, you can return a default value.
